name: Blawan
description:
'''Jamie Roberts''', better known by his stage name '''Blawan''', is an English [[Disc jockey|DJ]] and record producer from [[South Yorkshire]]. He is best known for his track "[[Why They Hide Their Bodies Under My Garage?]]" and his remix of the [[Radiohead]] track "Bloom", which appeared on their album'' [[TKOL RMX 1234567]]'' (2011). He came to prominence with his debut release ''Fram'' on the label Hessle Audio and signed to [[R&S Records]]. He also started a hardware-only project [[Karenn]], with fellow R&S producer Pariah. His stage name derives from [[Coffee production in Indonesia|Java Blawan coffee]], which he often drank while at university.

Credited as one of the artists spearheading the [[industrial techno]] revival, Blawan's [[post-dubstep]] sounds and raw, [[techno]]-influenced beats have earned him praise from DJs such as [[Surgeon (musician)|Surgeon]] and [[The Black Dog (band)|The Black Dog]]. According to Philip Sherburne of ''[[Pitchfork (magazine)|Pitchfork]]'', his music is "full of jackhammering kicks, splintered wooden percussion, and short-fuse breakdowns".
